attributes.action: Make it illegal to use parent-child spaces if you do not have a child with you
attributes.background: I would like parent-child spaces to be considered with the same respect as disabled spaces and be offered as a matter of course in all public car parks. As a mother of 2 infants I am left to struggle getting them out of the car in an unsafe space because people without a child use the child spaces.
attributes.additional_details: There is a safety issue as the extra space allowed in a child space means children can get in and out safely without being right next to the moving wheels of other vehicles. Additionally, these spaces are often closer to the trolley park or business entrance meaning if you have to get a special trolley to use or are carrying infants you don't have to go too far from the car in order to be able to do this safely. Having to carry children, baby bags and your shopping is very difficult already!

attributes.action: Provide funding to Staffordshire County Council to reduce a £35 million deficit
attributes.background: Staffordshire County Council has already slashed running costs by £240 million in 9 years. There is a further forecast £35 million reduction that will see much needed services for Staffordshire people reduced or even removed. Therefore we are asking the UK Government to provide adequate funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are just a few of the proposed cuts: 

• School crossing patrols
• Review cost of children’s resident provision
• Review alternative autism funding
• Review of Victoria Centre of history grant 
• Removal of non-statutory community transport 
• Removal of concessionary travel before 09.30 
• Reduction in grants to voluntary community social enterprise
• Review of Adult learning disability provisions to remove preventive services
• Review remaining financial support for hate crime

attributes.action: Immediately amend the future carbon budget targets
attributes.background:
The latest IPCC report, SR15, details the significant change of circumstances which have take place since the Climate Change Act of 2008.
We therefore need to amend the fourth carbon budget target to 60% by 2025 and the fifth to 70% by 2030.
attributes.additional_details: see http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

attributes.action: Ban plastic wrappers for individually sold greetings cards.
attributes.background:
Reducing single use plastic should be priority for all of us. 

This petition is over the use of plastic wrapping for individually sold greeings cards. 

Greetings card and envelopes are already sold without the need for plastic wrapping in a number of shops. This should be made mandatory.

attributes.action: NOT to ban the sale of fireworks to the public
attributes.background: Fireworks bring joy to many people of all ages and it is part of a tradition that goes back hundreds of years. Banning fireworks will not only ruin our Guy Fawkes tradition but will also have a massive impact on our multi cultural celebrations to such as diwali.

attributes.action: Reinstate Pension/Income Letters at Bangkok British Embassy
attributes.background:
As of the 12th of December 2018 British Citizens can no longer request a proof of income letter required to obtain a Retirement or Extension based on marriage visa in Thailand

Other Countries Embassy's have an option to sign an affidavit that your income is true.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Embassy has stated that this is because the Thai Immigration require proof that they cannot provide yet the current income letter already covers the embassy legally.  

The British Embassy has left us to resolve this with Thai immigration

The Thai immigration has not made any announcement and still requests the letter. Failing this retired or married Brits may be forced to transfer between £9-18,000 to a Thai bank as proof

attributes.action: NHS Allocation of Funds for PFO Closure in Selected Ischaemic Stroke Patients
attributes.background: Young and unsuspecting people suffer from stroke due to a hole in their heart called a PFO. There is a straight forward procedure scientifically proven to be statistically significant in reducing secondary stroke in these patients. The NHS does not currently allocate funding for this procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some links to relevant research: 

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/69/11_Supplement/1260

http://www.onlinejacc.org/content/56/13_Supplement/B108.3

Professional boxer Dan Sarkozi is an example of an unsuspecting victim of cryptogenic stroke. Dan suffered a cryptogenic stroke due to a hole in his heart which was originally believed to be a PFO. He faced the proposition of losing his career and spending his life on blood thinning medication due to lack of funding for this procedure.

attributes.action: The Government must publish its own Brexit Impact/Risk Assessments
attributes.background: We are heading towards the end of the A50 period and only 6% of MPs have read them. On that basis they can't be that important or hinder the negotiations, therefore releasing them to the public won't be a problem.
attributes.additional_details: This was previously debated but times have changed.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to learn how to pass equines safely,&include the highway code
attributes.background:
Educate new drivers about how to approach & overtake equines safely on the road.
Slowing down to a safe speed & passing with least 2m space.
Understand arm signals should a rider signal.
Safe passing can save lives.
Educate horse riders to wear hiviz and be seen.
attributes.additional_details:
The Glow Means Slow Campaign was created to help raise awareness to equestrians of how important it is to wear HiViz when out on the roads and rural lanes.
This is due to the rise In more accidents resulting in death and near misses lately between motorists and equines.
HiViz gives a driver between 3-5secs better reaction time.
A spooked horse can react at speeds up to 50mph.The recognised speed when injuries are more likely to result in death.

attributes.action: Don't charge food businesses 20% VAT on turnover
attributes.background: I want the government to stop charging food businesses 20% VAT. The reason for this is because our industry has barely any VAT to claim back and yet we get charged that 20% on our turnover which is unfair compared to other industries. This ruins cash flow and causes business owners financial issues.

attributes.action: UK Government to ban the import of shark fins into the UK.
attributes.background:
73 million sharks killed every year for shark fin soup, sharks are thrown back to the sea where they will die after having their fins brutally cut from their bodies.
 Loopholes are allowing people to continue smuggling fins in to the U.K despite a ban put in place in over 27 countries in 2013.

attributes.action: Avoid no deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has let us down with its negotiations with the EU and we are heading for a no deal scenario, which leaders in all fields say will be hugely damaging to the UK in many areas of life, from health to air travel to food imports. We must avoid a no deal situation.
attributes.additional_details: We need to accept we need more time to organise our departure from the EU and request an extension to the article 50 process. This will give the UK time to continue talks, hold an general election or seek further opinion from the public to determine how Brexit should proceed.  Most importantly we will avoid a damaging no deal scenario which will harm poor and vulnerable people the most

attributes.action: Increase use of restorative justice for adult offenders
attributes.background: Restorative Justice gives the victim the chance to have a meeting with their offender. In order for the meeting to take place, all of the parties have to agree to participate. The meeting is assisted by a mediator, and the aim is to discuss the offence and its consequences as a group.
attributes.additional_details: Researches show that RJ satisfies 85% of the victims and reduces the re-offending rate by 14% [https://restorativejustice.org.uk/criminal-justice]. Young offenders are offered RJ where appropriate, but this does not occur enough for adult offenders. We would like the government to introduce legislation that makes it mandatory to offer RJ to adult offenders where appropriate. Please sign if you agree that this would be a positive move forward for victims, offenders and the Criminal Justice per se. #RJ4EVERYONE

attributes.action: Increase the cycle to work scheme limit from £1000 to £2000.
attributes.background: Introduced in 1999, the scheme allows workers to buy a bike and accessories through their workplace. If the scheme’s limit had tracked inflation it would now be over £1,600. In addition, e-bikes are now becoming popular, provide access to cycling to more people, but are even more expensive.
attributes.additional_details:
Some organisations have obtained permission from the FCA to provide loans to a higher limit, but many do not do this (e.g. due to the complexity of obtaining permission and costs).

This is a timely petition as officials from DfT, HMT and HMRC are reviewing the scheme’s guidance (including the limit) as part of the Government’s Cycling and Walking Investment Strategy.

Source of inflation data: https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/monetary-policy/inflation/inflation-calculator

attributes.action: DEFRA support Farmers Transitioning to Arable Farming
attributes.background: To help and support Farmers Transitioning from Animal Agriculture to Arable Farming

attributes.action: Set up a Select Committee for Adults with Learning Disabilities.
attributes.background: The working practice of services regarding adults with learning disabilities need investigating root to branch inside and out by a specially appointed Select Committee.
attributes.additional_details: Not fit for purpose the Parliamentary Health & Social Care Ombudsman,  Local Government Ombudsman, UNISON and others fail to provide a service and/or adequate standard of service to deal with Adults with Learning  Disabilities.

attributes.action: Freeze rail fares across British service providers in January 2019
attributes.background: This petition asks the Government to commit to a "fares freeze" for regulated fares next year, as rail fares are expected to increase by 3.2% in 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite the lack of service improvements, failure to deliver compensation, the disruption caused by new timetables, consumers are still being told that fare increases are justified.

National Punctuality (PPM) in Q4 of 2017 was recorded at 86.4%, indicating a decline of 27pp compared to 2016-17. (Source: orr.gov.uk)

National Reliability (CaSL) in Q4 of 2017 was 4.8%, which also indicates a drop in quality of service and a decrease of 1.4pp compared to 2016-17. (Source: orr.gov.uk)

The ORR also discovered that 59% of consumers that made complaints to National Rail providers in 2017-18 were dissatisfied with the outcome of their complaint.

This petition proposes that all regulated train fares are frozen in January 2019.

attributes.action: To make all schools and nursery’s nut free environments
attributes.background: I have two young children both with serious nut allergies. One is at infant school and one is a toddler. There are not that many nurseries or schools with nut free policies and our children spend a lot of time in these environments and we need to be sure that they are in safe hands on a daily basis.

attributes.action: We call on the Government to abandon the HS2 Rail project.
attributes.background: With the projected cost of HS2 rising towards £100bn, it would be better to stop the project now and use the money saved to provide free solar panels to the whole of the country.
attributes.additional_details: The former Chairman of Eurostar, Adam Mills, wrote that the claimed social and economic benefits of HS@ were "away with the fairies". He added, it would be far wiser to spend the money on traditional  rail enhancements given the relatively short distances between UK cities. In economic terms HS@ is unjustifiable. Existing trains  between London and Birmingham are underused at present and saving business men 30 minutes of travelling time does not justify the destruction of 1740 buildings including 888 homes, together with 60 irreplaceable ancient woodlands being destroyed.

attributes.action: Pass a law to prevent landlords refusing people to have pets.
attributes.background: We request you pass a law that forbids landlords to deny tenants a pet as it will prove beneficial for people and animals alike.
attributes.additional_details: Having pets has been proved to be very beneficial for health, lowering blood pressure, helping with stress etc. For people living alone they are companionship. For children, it educates them about caring and having compassion for other living creatures along with responsibility of such. With so many animal shelters full, the problem is being exhasperated by private landlords denying people a basic right to have a pet. For time immemorial people have kept animals as pets and surely it is within their human rights to do so.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to be accessible to disabilities
attributes.background: We want there to be an introduction of legislation which mandates all UK schools to be fully accessible.This will include setting out national guidelines for schools to follow, taking the responsibility away from the local authorities ensures there will be consistency in the levels of accessibility.
attributes.additional_details:
Our hope is that one day, disabilities will no longer be a barrier to living life to the full. People with disabilities should never face discrimination and should never be excluded from buildings or activities because of a lack of access.

In a recent report by the Children's Commissioner Sally Holland, it was discovered that 4 out of 22 councils did not have their strategies in place even though they are required to do so by law, and the government have not updated their guidance since 2004!

attributes.action: Introduce legal standards for reporting tools on social media
attributes.background:
Finding disturbing accounts on social media which impact young children need to be investigated and removed with immediate effect. 

When reporting on social media the response is automated, you get told they won’t remove the account and the options are limited!
attributes.additional_details: It’s worrying that this happens even when reporting possible grooming of young girls.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to vaccinate your children
attributes.background: Intentionally not vaccinating children, except in cases where there are health risks, should not be allowed. It increases the risks of infection to the child and to other children.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 20th August 2018 it was revealed by Public Health England that in the first half of 2018 there were over 800 cases of measles, almost four times as many as there were in the entirety of 2017. 

According to the NHS, 4 out of the 6 vaccinations given to 1 and 2 year olds showed decreases in immunisations which is a worrying development. 
 
France has already made immunizations a legal requirement.
 
Between 2004 and 2014 there were nearly 10,000 cases of Measles and over 81,000 cases of mumps

attributes.action: Protect the welfare of small animals by banning their sale from retail outlets
attributes.background: Despite the requirement to be licensed by the local authority, pets for sale in large stores are kept in conditions that frequently do not meet RSPCA minimum welfare standards. Many are bought on a whim,or without prior research in to their ongoing care.Most end up in rescue or abandoned
attributes.additional_details: In 2018, why is there the need to purchase pets from a shop? I would envisage the profit margin from such sales to be  minimal,the main income being from pet food and supplies, not to mention the dreadful hutches on sale that do not meet RSPCA minimum welfare standards?  Stressed rabbits are more likely to become ill.Bred for profit and kept in small glass cages, on sawdust, without their natural freedoms, their lethargy and distress is evident .Help me end this inhumane practise

attributes.action: Make the denial of genocide in Srebrenica illegal and subject to prosecution
attributes.background:
In July 1995, more than 8,373 Bosniaks, mainly men and boys were murdered in cold blood, in Srebrenica during the Bosnian War.
As this was a clear act of genocide, it should be illegal to deny this event ever happened.
attributes.additional_details:
The International Court of Justice (ICJ) ruled that the Srebrenica massacre was a genocide and was not just limited to men, but also to women and children, with the youngest victim being a newborn baby.
With human life being so precious, denial of their demise gives justification to the perpetrators of this heinous crime.

attributes.action: Take immediate action to reduce emissions by 45% from 2010 levels by 2030.
attributes.background: The government must take immediate measures to limit global temperature rise to 1.5C, as advised by the UN's recent climate report. To achieve this, emissions need to be cut drastically in the next 12 years. Meanwhile, the government has been backing out of policies which achieve these targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Some actions should include:

-Boost renewable energy sources to 85% by 2050- (suggested in the UN report).
-Quickly phase out fossil fuels, especially coal.
-Reduce our dependance on gas and oil.
-Reinstate previous subsidies for electric/hybrid cars and ban the sale of fossil fuel cars within the decade.
-Expand and encourage the use of public transport across the UK.
-Encourage individuals to act and educate the public on sustainable living.
-Invest in technology to take CO2 from the air.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence in the UK not to report discovering a death
attributes.background: Recently my brother passed away and the person who was staying with him never rang for help just left him on his own. I want to make this a criminal offence in the UK as it’s against the law in other countries. I need to get as many signatures as I can so no other family has to go through this.

attributes.action: Quadruple the Manchester Piccadilly - Manchester Oxford Road Rail Corridor
attributes.background: In 2009, as part of the Northern Hub project, the Manchester Piccadilly - Manchester Oxford Road Rail Corridor was set to be quadrupled, with two new platforms (15/16) built at Manchester Piccadilly, yet this project has now been "postponed" indefinitely.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2018, the number of trains through the existing corridor (through platforms 13/14) was increased, despite the lack of available capacity, causing constant disruption. Despite this, Transport Secretary Chris Grayling has "postponed" the project indefinitely.

The rail passengers of Manchester and the North deserve better. These new platforms are urgently needed, as the current situation is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Only allow uni students to vote in their home town, not where they are studying.
attributes.background: Currently, university students can either vote in their uni town or home town and many choose the former. The huge density of students in certain areas now mean that students control the vote and their issues can dominate the political agenda and effectively disenfranchise the local community.
attributes.additional_details: This is not driven by anti-student sentiment but more through a sense of democracy. For example, if there was a General Election in their first week at uni, the student could vote in the uni town without any knowledge of local issues or the local MP. They will probably spend 27 months over 3 years at uni and yet a parliamentary term is 60 months, so their vote affects the area long after they've left! They can also vote in local elections, on local issues from Day 1.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Flexible working, maternity leave and nursing facilities are examples of protected provisions available to workers. Student mothers are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination, yet these protections are seldom extended to them.This blind-spot has led to avoidable adversity and exclusion.
attributes.additional_details:
Education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring that the same rights are extended to students who are mothers.

In spite of the Equality Act 2010, the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result. This must change.

attributes.action: Home Office to confirm right to work on applications by way of acknowledgement
attributes.background: Those who work within the legal profession are aware that section 3C Immigration Act 1971 allow applicants who submit in time applications the right to reside and work in the UK whilst their applications are pending. Employers are  requesting for written confirmation by way of acknowledgement.
attributes.additional_details:
Family Members of EEA Nationals are issued such letters by way of Certificate of Application. Home Office should simplify the process by issuing Certificate of Application for immigration applications to help laymen, employers and employees.

The two tier system is causing confusing and individuals are being suspended from work unjustifiably and this can be resolved by the Home Office adopting the Certificate of Application style for all British linked immigration applications.

attributes.action: Same sex unmarried/civil partnered parents to be on Childs birth certificate
attributes.background: In the UK same sex parents of donor children are unable to both go on their childs birth certificate - unless they are married/ civil partnered preconception or the child was conceived through the help of a registered fertility clinic. My son has only me on his birth certificate and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it ok for heterosexual couples to both be registered on birth certificate, some of these Fathers registered are not even the biological Fathers and no questions asked.

If anything were to happen to me my son would be an orphan due to no other parent having rights over him.

As a nation we have come so far with equality and rights, however the legislation and laws need to be updated to reflect this.

attributes.action: Award a separate medal to recognise the Bomb Disposal Service in WWII
attributes.background: A watercolour began my journey of discovery leading to the heroic acts by the artist Capt. John Hannaford & his colleagues. 350 men were killed defusing, clearing bombs, UXBs, over 50,000 across the UK. Many were killed clearing mines from our beaches. They deserve official recognition.
attributes.additional_details: Capt. Hannaford’s notes, photographs, his in-depth interview at 95 for the IWM with a Channel 4 documentary highlight his belief that the bomb disposal service men and women were forgotten. Footage included other WWII bomb disposal officers telling their heroic story and acts of courage of all their servicemen. Whilst researching I discovered the most powerful evidence was a quote from our great statesman Winston Churchill who said, "Bomb Disposal should be recognised for their dangerous work!"

attributes.action: Scrap the sugar tax.
attributes.background: This year the Government brought in a sugar tax, which is a tax on any drink with above a certain level of sugar content. The problem is that companies are now replacing sugar with artificial sweeteners and these are argued to be more harmful than sugar. Scrap the tax for choice and for our health.
attributes.additional_details: Drinks with more than 8g per 100ml face a tax rate equivalent to 24p per litre. Those containing 5-8g of sugar per 100ml face 18p per litre. While this may appear as if you just pay more for the product, instead it is becoming very difficult to get a product without artificial additives. With many pubs, bars no longer serving sugar drinks. Aspartame is one of the most popular sweeteners and some studies indicate it could be carcinogenic. We deserve real choice.

attributes.action: Ban 'anti-homeless' benches in the UK
attributes.background: Just under a quarter of a million people are estimated to be sleeping rough in Britain, 2018. 'Anti-homeless' benches force the homeless to sleep on the cold floor this winter. Divided benches are an example of how the housing problem has not been tackled, with efforts to only blanket the truth.
attributes.additional_details: More than one in three people sleeping rough have been deliberately hit or kicked or experienced some other form of violence whilst homeless. If these individuals could spend the night on a bench, they could be away from the floor, nightclub doors or store entrances, in safer areas. The homeless are entitled to the same as any person, and these benches must be banned.

attributes.action: Stop the tax payer funding Royal weddings.
attributes.background: Stop the tax payer funding royal weddings including the upcoming wedding. The Government needs to advise the Queen of the public outrage at this disgraceful waste of public money. The Royal Family have more than enough tax payer money to fund this flamboyant wedding themselves.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of public funding cuts to libraries, roads maintenance, police service and other publicly funding bodies it is a disgrace that the Government is even considering funding this wedding.

attributes.action: Continue to fund free TV licences for the over 75 in the future.
attributes.background: Removing them will only penalize the poorest old age pensioners, many who rely on their television for company and their main source of entertainment.

attributes.action: Have a second EU referendum and allow 15 to 17 year olds to vote as well
attributes.background: As a 16 year old and hearing all the stuff in the news it frustrates me. As my age is the next generation and we should have a say on what we want our future to look like. It’s not fair for people who’ll be long gone to vote the future of the next generation. Us teenagers 15+ should have our say.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for MPs & immediate family to own shares in weapon manufacturers
attributes.background: If an MP has a personal interest in share prices increasing for weapon manufacture companies, they cannot be considered to be truly impartial when creating policy surrounding weapon sales to countries with poor human rights records.

attributes.action: Promote plant-based lifestyles
attributes.background: We now know we are 12 years away from climate catastrophe. And that the single biggest thing we can do to reduce our impact on the Earth is to eliminate animal products from our diet. Yet any talk of the government encouraging us to adopt a vegan diet is swept aside as ‘nanny-stateism.’
attributes.additional_details:
Animal products are everywhere and not just in our food. If the public have any hope of achieving a plant-based lifestyle they need state help. The government needs to:
 
• Make menus in public institutions entirely vegan 
• Tax any product that contains animal products 
• Stop giving incentives to people who farm animals 
• Incentivise those who grow or produce vegan foods 
• Educate the public about plant-based living
 
For the future of our planet this subject urgently needs debate in parliament.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees of Universities from £9,250 back to £3000 per year
attributes.background:
The cost of university fees in the UK are unacceptable seeing as public universities are financed by the government. 
It's not fair for students from low socioeconomic backgrounds who struggle finaiacially and students from higher economic background to be expected to pay the same fee of £9,250.
attributes.additional_details:
most uni's in the EU are free ,however, what we are seeing is that Universities are continuing to increase their fees and reduce the grants available. The saddest issue here is all courses cost the same, that means a degree in nursing costs the same per year as denistry. 
As a result it's making higher education more attractive to students who can afford it and making it more difficult for students from deprived areas and low income families make it to uni's due to the fear of burdening loans.

attributes.action: To create awareness amongst children/teenagers about Autism/Aspergers in schools
attributes.background: I would like the government make this a small part of personal studies in schools to give children/teenagers an understanding about children living with Autism/Aspergers in social situations. It will help them to be able to recognize behavior traits and actions in order to understand.
attributes.additional_details:
A small part of the curriculum would help so many children with Autism/Aspergers be able to feel comfortable in social situations such as playing, school and parties without being judged, bullied or name called. 
Being able to integrate into social situations is key but not easy for children living with these conditions. 
Ways of communicating and showing emotion are very different from child to child but can be seen as behavior problems if not understood. 
All children deserve to happy & secure

attributes.action: Life sentence for causing death by dangerous driving, including first offences
attributes.background: July 1st 2017 was the day my 17 year old brother, Stephen, was killed due to dangerous driving. The driver was on multiple drugs as well as being fuelled with alcohol. The car they had was not theirs, they had no insurance, no tax and no licence! They also seriously injured a young girl.
attributes.additional_details: The offender was not sentenced until 9 months after Stephen’s death. During this time we didn’t see the offender show any remorse. They appeared to be out partying, drinking and taking drugs. The offender was sentenced to just 8 years in prison and because they pleaded guilty, they got a third knocked off this sentence and because it was a first offence the sentence will be reduced by further third.

attributes.action: Ban all gambling advertising on TV
attributes.background: Problem gambling cost this country up to 1.2 billion pounds per year according to official figures. It is also linked to mental health and homelessness. Along with smoking gambling adverts do not belong on the television. Many gambling adverts promote it as glamorous - this is highly irresponsible.

attributes.action: Ban animal glue traps
attributes.background:
Glue traps are used as a method of trapping animals however this results in an agonising, slow and painful death for the creature who has sadly been caught. 
Commonly these traps are often laid down to catch vermin however many animals such as Endangered rodents, lizards and even birds are trapped.
attributes.additional_details: Many companies thought America have already banned the sale of these awful death traps.

attributes.action: " Mandatory for all hospital theatres to evacuate diathermy tissue smoke plume"
attributes.background: In 2007, smoking was banned in the UK. In operating theatres  we are still '"smoking" because some consultants are reluctant to use this technology .This continues to put perioperative staff and patients at risk of breathing in smoke which contains many harmful compounds including hydrogen cyanide.

attributes.action: Stop unregulated animal “rescues” bringing animals into the UK
attributes.background: Many “rescues” bringing dogs into the UK are un-regulated businesses disguised as “rescues”. Only registered animal charities should be allowed to bring dogs into the UK. It should be an offence for unregistered “rescues” to bring dogs into the UK for sale or adoption.
attributes.additional_details: They can cause dire cruelty to dogs. No regulation means cash in hand. No help is given when dogs are homed. Dogs are un-assessed, homes are un-checked & NO rescue back up is given to help. These people are just dog SELLERS. ‘Donations’ & ‘adoption fees’ for dogs go straight into their pockets. The fundraising is also a scam!

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Afghans
attributes.background:
Many Afghans deported risk either being killed or never being able to start a life again. Some have been killed. A country at war for the last 40 years cannot promise anything, let alone the beginning of a new life.
Please help us get 100,000 signatures and stop the deportations.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/zainadin-fazlie-deport-home-office-taliban-afghanistan-shot-dead-refugee-a8536736.html

attributes.action: Respond with urgency to the IPCC report to limit global warming
attributes.background: We have been warned, we must act now.  Parliament must act to change electricity production to renewable sources within 10 years.  Bring forward measures to decarbonise car transport within 10 years. Insulate every property within 10 years. And take every other reasonable measure to cut carbon.

attributes.action: Require hounds to be muzzled when out trail or drag hunting to protect wildlife
attributes.background: Wildlife can get ripped apart when hounds on trail or drag hunts come across them. Fox hunting was banned in the UK but the loopholes in the law allow hunts to continue their tradition . This is unlikely to end so i propose that hounds are muzzled during these hunts
